Title: Senior Data Scientist - (Logistics, Pricing)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist (all genders) to join our "Data Science Pricing" squad in Logistics on our journey to deliver amazing experiences. Pricing is one of the most impactful levers in our business‚Äîand you‚Äôll be shaping how it works across dozens of markets and millions of customers. In this role, you‚Äôll tackle a wide range of pricing-related challenges‚Äîfrom developing intelligent pricing algorithms to advancing our experimentation techniques. You will support other Data Scientists in delivering high-quality solutions, challenge assumptions, and help raise the bar for data science practices across our teams.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you‚Äôll work closely with multiple cross-functional teams to build and maintain scalable, reliable machine learning services deployed globally.

If you're a skilled Data Scientist and creative problem solver who‚Äôs eager to make an impact, an international workplace awaits you in the heart of Berlin!

Our pricing systems operate at the heart of a fast-moving, global food delivery business‚Äîdirectly influencing customer experience and company performance.

Your mission:


Design and implement automation and experimentation algorithms for pricing, from conception to production.
Take technical ownership and uphold high quality standards within the team. Mentor junior team members.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary stakeholders and translate business needs into data science solutions.
Stay up to date with the latest research and suggest state-of-the-art models to improve customer outcomes.
Contribute to long-term strategic planning and defining a short-term roadmap to tackle complex and meaningful data problems.
Most importantly: You‚Äôre excited to build global systems affecting millions of customers, and you continuously drive for excellence.


Qualifications


Solid statistical skills‚Äîyou‚Äôre confident with fundamentals and first-principles thinking in statistics and machine learning theory.
Strong engineering background‚Äîyou write clean, maintainable Python code and SQL queries, following best practices for production systems.
Deep expertise in at least one relevant domain (e.g., causal inference, time series, Bayesian methods, neural networks, NLP/LLM, ranking/matching, advanced experimentation).
Thoughtful approach‚Äîyou challenge assumptions and care deeply about working with clean, trustworthy data.
Substantial experience in a business environment where you developed a strong business understanding.
Clear communicator‚Äîyou can distill complex requirements from many stakeholders into a clear, MVP-ready direction.
You value agile processes, data-driven development, reliability, and rigorous experimentation.


Nice to have:


Experience in pricing or food delivery business.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Scientist - Berlin (All Genders)
Description:
Digitl ist ein Unternehmen aus dem Bereich Marketing und Cloud-Technologie. Du hast die Chance, ein junges Unternehmen mit aufzubauen. Wir sind praxisnahe Spezialisten, die es sich zur Aufgabe gemacht haben, das Thema Service im digitalen Marketing noch innovativer anzugehen. Neue Ideen und frische Ans√§tze sind bei uns immer willkommen. Bei Digitl hast du nicht nur die Chance auf eine Karriere mit Gr√ºndergeist, du arbeitest auch mit spannenden Kunden zusammen und stehst in engem Kontakt mit unseren Ansprechpartnern bei Google.


Tasks



Du entwickelst und leitest innovative Data Science- und Machine Learning-Projekte im digitalen Marketing, insbesondere Marketing Mix Modelings und pr√§diktive Modelle


Als Teil des Consultings bist Du von Anfang bis Ende in verschiedene Projekte und Kunden involviert und erg√§nzt das Team und unsere Kunden f√ºr bestm√∂gliche Ergebnisse


Deine Rolle ist sehr vielf√§ltig und reicht vom Projektmanagement √ºber jeden Schritt des CRISP-DM-Zyklus, vom Gesch√§ftsverst√§ndnis √ºber die Datenextraktion und Modellierung bis hin zur Bereitstellung und √úberwachung.


Du arbeitest interdisziplin√§r mit unseren Cloud-, Digital Analytics- und Ad Technology-Teams zusammen, um bestehende L√∂sungen zu verbessern und neue zu entwickeln.


Du bist √ºber die neuesten Trends und Entwicklungen informiert und liebst es Dein Wissen weiterzugeben.





.


Qualifications



Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium (z. B. Data Science, Statistik, Mathematik, Informatik)


Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Science und/oder maschinelles Lernen - mit Schwerpunkt auf digitalem Marketing und Marketing Mix Modeling oder pr√§diktiven Modellen


Statistik- und Machine-Learning-Kenntnisse, insbesondere Bayes'sche Regression und Klassifikation


Kenntnisse in SQL, Python und f√ºhrenden Data-Science-Tools (z. B. Jupyter Notebooks, GitHub)


Erfahrung mit Google Marketing Platform Tools und Daten (z. B. Google Analytics, Google Ads) und Visualisierungstools (z. B. Looker Studio) ist ein Plus


Erfahrung in der Beratung von Kunden; Erkl√§ren und Pr√§sentieren komplexer Inhalte auf einfache und sichere Art und Weise


Erfahrung im Projektmanagement


Klare Kommunikation in Wort und Schrift - in flie√üendem Deutsch und Englisch


Teamf√§higkeit



Perks & Benefits



Co-Working: Dir steht ein Platz in den besten Co-Working Spaces in D√ºsseldorf, Z√ºrich, Barcelona oder Hamburg zur Verf√ºgung.


Remote 1st: Alle unsere Prozesse sind auf dezentrales Arbeiten ausgelegt. Du entscheidest, ob du lieber vom Home Office aus arbeitest oder deinen Tag in einem unserer B√ºros verbringst.


Home-Office-Ausstattung: Wir stellen dir eine hochwertige Standardausstattung f√ºr deine Remote-Arbeitsumgebung zur Verf√ºgung.


Tierliebhaber: Wenn du einen Hund hast, bring ihn mit zur Arbeit.


Kompetenzerweiterung: Als hochspezialisierter Technologiepartner unterst√ºtzen wir deine Entwicklung mit Zertifizierungen, Konferenzbesuchen und Schulungsm√∂glichkeiten.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Work Location: Berlin or Amsterdam

Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background and experience in crafting top-shelf prediction models? You are passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Scientist we're looking for!

Your primary responsibilities will be:


Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges
Translate business needs into hypotheses, leading to advanced analytical projects, and conduct ad hoc analyses to address specific business questions
Design, train, deploy and monitor predictive algorithms
Proactively communicate and share your conclusions, as well as explain complex topics to technical and non-technical stakeholders


What we're looking for:


Solid analytical skills in structured and unstructured data (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
A self-driven and proactive attitude
Strong verbal and written communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Knowledge of financial markets & financial products (options, futures, etc.)


What we offer:


Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience
Free lunch from our cook, fresh juices & fruit
Continuous growth potential and a training budget of ‚Ç¨2,000 per year
Trips & activities with your colleagues
Relaxed and informal working environment
Discount for membership of the Urban Sports Club
Additional contribution to the company pension scheme
In-house German and English courses with a native speaker and cover half of the costs


About us:

LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The best choice for anyone who takes investing seriously:

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist / AI Engineer
Description:
Join our mission to fight climate change

Do you want to be part of one of Europe‚Äôs fastest-growing climate tech startups? We‚Äôre looking for a data scientist with a passion for building scalable data and AI solutions both to provide innovative solutions for our product, an innovative carbon management software solution, and to support internal workflows.

If you‚Äôre excited about building an economy where every company creates real impact for a sustainable world, and empowering companies to decarbonize while growing their business, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

THE ROLE

Your mission:

You have a strong passion for implementing innovative data solutions to solve business problems. You will play a pivotal role in identifying opportunities for innovative data and AI solutions both to bring new data centric features to our product and to support internal workflows. You will own the implementation of such solutions end to end from defining the solutions together with product managers and internal stakeholders to implementing them hands on yourself and bringing them live.

üîç What you'll do:


Identify opportunities for innovative data and AI solutions to drive innovation in how carbon management is done
Identify opportunities for innovative data and AI solutions to support internal workflows and drive internal efficiency
Build production ready data and AI solutions with a diverse set of tools for both our product and internal usage (e.g. Python, dbt, Dagster)
Collaborate closely with product managers and software engineers to conceptualize the solution and bring it live in our product
Write clean, production-level Python code and manage deployments in line with best practices


üí°We think you‚Äôll thrive in this role if you


You‚Äôre passionate about identifying and implementing innovative data solutions
You have a proven track record of building robust, scalable and easy to maintain data solutions in Python and are comfortable with building Python based microservices using tools such as fastAPI, Django or Flask
You have experience in using a diverse set of machine learning techniques to solve business problems
You have experience in using novel AI techniques, in particular LLMs/GenAI models, to solve business problems
You‚Äôre eager to keep on top of the development of new AI models and use cases, and use the opportunities that open up as the technology progresses


üíö Why Cozero?

We‚Äôre building the first Climate ERP system for companies - a software platform to measure, manage, and reduce corporate carbon emissions with confidence. Backed by ‚Ç¨6.5M Series A funding (led by Kvanted and ENV), we work with global leaders like Maersk, Nippon Express Europe, and DMG MORI.

At Cozero, we believe that great products are built by empowered teams. You‚Äôll work closely with our co-founders Fabian, Helen, and Tiago in a highly dynamic, multicultural, and purpose-driven environment.

üíºWhat we offer:


A remote-first working environment with the option to work from our office at the heart of Berlin with access to innovation events of the German Mittelstand and the startup ecosystem
27 vacation days per year + National holidays
Virtual meditation and wellness sessions
Frequent team events and at least 2 offsites per year
A one time 500‚Ç¨ home-office equipment stipend
A 500‚Ç¨ annual learning and development budget
Monthly budget for coworking space for employees outside of Berlin
Participation in Cozero‚Äôs Virtual Stock Option Plan (VSOP), to have direct involvement and impact on Cozero‚Äôs success
A strong company culture focused on growth, collaboration and fighting climate change
Access to startup & accelerator programs, sustainability networks, and more


How to apply

We strive to build a diverse, inclusive and collaborative workplace and we follow a fair, objective, and non-discriminatory recruitment process. All applications will be considered for employment regardless of nationality, culture, or any other personal characteristics. If you need any special requirements during the interview process please do let us know.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Ever wanted to tell people, "Yeah, I helped launch the future of transportation"? Well, here's your shot. At Vay, we're flipping the script on mobility with Remote driving‚Äîdelivering cars to customers with zero hassle and zero driver inside, offering a unique by the minute car rental service. We're already live in Las Vegas, and trust us, we're just getting started.

Our journey so far since our launch in 2018:

Revolutionary remote driving tech- We built the world's first commercial remote driving product.

Breaking boundaries across continents- First to roll out vehicles in both Europe and the USA on public roads without a human being inside & one of only two companies in the States operating a commercial driverless service.

Vegas fleet on the rise- Our vehicle fleet is scaling fast, from 20 to 100 cars in Las Vegas. We're just getting started!

Watch our CEO, Thomas von der Ohe, deliver a live news segment on CNN - VayDrive

Discover what drives our culture- Explore our core values

Why this role is awesome:

In this exciting role, you'll play a critical part in developing and scaling the data-driven foundations of our remote driving service. From understanding how our fleet behaves to forecasting customer demand, your work will directly influence how we grow and operate.

You'll join a deep-tech team tackling unique challenges at the intersection of mobility, AI, and real-world operations, where every model you build has a direct, tangible impact on our product and customer experience.

What you'll be driving:


Design, test, and deploy machine learning models to analyze cellular network performance, predict fleet behavior, and forecast demand.
Handle large, dynamic datasets, transforming raw data into actionable insights through preprocessing and feature engineering.
Integrate models into production systems and fine-tune them for real-time performance.
Continuously monitor model outputs and iterate based on new data and operational feedback.
Collaborate closely with engineering, operations, and product teams to translate business challenges into scalable data solutions.
Contribute to our data science roadmap and help us push the boundaries of what's possible with predictive modelling.


What are we looking for:


Solid foundation in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning concepts.
Proficient in Python and SQL, with experience using libraries like Scikit-learn, Pandas, TensorFlow, or similar.
Hands-on experience in building predictive models and deploying them in real-world systems.
Strong data wrangling and preprocessing skills, with comfort handling large-scale, complex datasets.
Curious, proactive, and excited to solve hard problems in a fast-paced environment.
Bonus: experience in mobility, fleet optimization, or telecommunications data.

Title: ML Engineer (LLM)
Description:
Synthflow AI is a no-code platform for deploying voice AI agents that automate phone calls across contact center operations and business process outsourcing (BPO) at scale. We help mid-market and enterprise companies manage routine calls to save teams time and resources.

Our agents have already delivered measurable impact:


Over 5 million hours of contact center operations saved
35% more calls answered compared to non-AI operators
45 million calls handled with a 99.9% uptime


Backed by Accel, Atlantic Labs, and Singular and trusted by over 1,000 customers, our growth leads an industry shift toward sophisticated and accessible conversational AI.

The Role

We are looking for a hands‚Äëon ML Engineer who lives at the intersection of TTS, STT and large language models. You will design and ship new low‚Äëlatency voice capabilities, working closely with product, research and infrastructure teams to push the boundaries of natural, multilingual conversation.

What You‚Äôll Do


Architect & implement real‚Äëtime speech pipelines (ASR ‚Üí LLM ‚Üí TTS) that meet stringent latency and quality targets.
Evaluate and fine‚Äëtune state‚Äëof‚Äëthe‚Äëart ASR, LLM and TTS models‚Äîboth commercial and open‚Äësource‚Äîand integrate the best performers into production.
Optimise inference through quantisation, distillation, hardware‚Äëaware graph compilation and reinforcement‚Äëlearning‚Äëbased tuning.
Expose scalable APIs & micro‚Äëservices with Python/FastAPI, gRPC or WebSocket streaming, backed by robust observability and autoscaling.
Own deployment across cloud and on‚Äëprem environments, collaborating on containerisation (Docker), orchestration (Kubernetes) and CI/CD workflows.
Stay ahead of the curve by tracking research, running experiments and sharing learnings with the broader team.


What We‚Äôre Looking For


Python Engineering: 5+ years writing production‚Äëgrade, well‚Äëtested Python; deep familiarity with async, typing and performance profiling
Speech / Audio: Hands‚Äëon experience building real‚Äëtime ASR, TTS, voice chat or streaming audio products
LLM Tooling: Fine‚Äëtuning, prompt design, evaluation, retrieval‚Äëaugmented generation; familiarity with frameworks such as Openpipe/ART, LangChain, LlamaIndex or similar
Systems & MLOps: Containerisation, GPU scheduling, observability, DevOps on GCP or AWS; infrastructure‚Äëas‚Äëcode principles
API Design: Building and maintaining high‚Äëthroughput REST/gRPC/FastAPI services; securing and monitoring them in production


Bonus Points


Model compression expertise (quantisation, pruning, ONNX/TensorRT)
Knowledge of audio and acoustics
Experience with reinforcement‚Äëlearning‚Äëfrom‚Äëhuman‚Äëfeedback (RLHF) or direct preference optimisation
Contributions to open‚Äësource ML/speech projects (share your GitHub!)
Familiarity with GPU inference servers (Triton, KServe) or distributed compute frameworks (Ray)


Founded in Berlin in 2023 by serial entrepreneurs Albert Astabatsyan, Hakob Astabatsyan, and Sassun Mirzakhan-Saky, Synthflow AI democratizes access to advanced voice AI with a no-code platform that lets enterprises easily create, deploy and scale natural-sounding, cost-effective voice agents tailored to their business needs.


Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - (Logistics, Optimization)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are looking for a (Senior) Machine Learning Engineer to join the Logistics Optimization team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

The Optimization Tribe's purpose is to maximize Delivery Hero's logistics performance. We achieve this by owning and continuously improving the sophisticated algorithm that solves the real-time vehicle routing problem, assigning orders efficiently every minute. This directly impacts DH's core efficiency and customer satisfaction KPIs, influencing decisions for stakeholders from Operations to Product.

As an ML Engineer, your value lies in tackling the problems at scale head-on and building ML products which shape the algorithm's logic and decisions to meet our long-term goals of best-in-class efficiency and service, making a tangible impact across the Delivery Hero network. Are you ready to take your Machine Learning Engineering skills to the next level and make a tangible impact on millions of users worldwide?

In this role you will,


Build the infrastructure that powers critical model inputs fed every minute to the dispatch algorithm which shapes experiences for millions of customers across the globe, every single day.
Design , build and maintain a scalable ML infrastructure to manage the entire ML lifecycle at scale.
Develop Tooling: Build and enhance ML engineering tooling for Model Development, Model Workbench, Model Training, Model monitoring, and Model serving.
Collaborate and Optimize: Work closely with data scientists, analysts and data engineers to understand their needs and build solutions that optimize their workflows.
Leverage Cloud: Utilize modern technologies and public cloud infrastructure to build highly available systems for multiple teams.
Scale and Perform: Build solutions at scale, optimizing for performance and efficiency.
Address Pain Points: Understand the pain points of application teams and translate them into robust platform features.
Innovate and Suggest: Proactively suggest how the team can leverage new technologies and architectures to support new use cases.


Qualifications


Software Engineering Expertise: At least 4 years of experience in software engineering with hands-on experience with modern programming languages such as Python, Java, or Golang.
Technical Evaluation: Experience in tech explorations to evaluate technologies for business problems and proposing solutions based on comprehensive pros and cons analysis.
Proof of Concept: Prior experience building proof of concepts for solving system design challenges using open-source tools.
Application Development: Experience building new applications from scratch.
System Analysis: Experience in deep-diving into existing systems for investigations and improvements.
ML Engineering Experience: Prior experience in ML engineering or MLOps.
Communication Skills: Fluency in English. Clarity in communication, both written and verbal.


Nice to Have


Prior knowledge of public cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud or equivalent).
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform or equivalent).
Familiarity with the ML engineering ecosystem, such as Model serving, training, and feature engineering pipelines.
Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools like Docker, Kubernetes, and Helm.
Experience with ML tools like Metaflow, MLflow, Argo Workflows, and Cloud Notebooks.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

We are seeking a technically skilled and passionate Mid-Level/Senior Data Scientist with expertise in advanced machine learning methods to join our international and dynamic Data Science Department at AUTO1 Group Technology. AUTO1 Group is Europe's leading digital automotive platform. We revolutionise the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de, and AUTO1.com. We are dedicated to leverage cutting-edge technology to develop Machine learning solutions that optimize our sales and processes.

You will shape the next generation of data-driven inventory selection solutions that power all stages of our business, from retail to dealer networks. This includes designing and evolving advanced modeling approaches, exploring scalable architectures, and building a versatile library of machine learning algorithms that address complex challenges and deliver measurable impact. Your work will focus on developing flexible, high-impact solutions to optimize the sourcing and inflow of second-hand vehicles, driving end-to-end processes‚Äîfrom researching to prototyping and deploying scalable models that enhance our inventory pipeline.

We are excited to work with talented contributors. Join us in shaping the future of automotive dealer sales with machine learning solutions!

Job Description


Contribute to building robust sourcing models that drive measurable business impact by optimizing vehicle inflow and ensure long-term scalability of our inventory sourcing operations.
Translate business needs into machine learning solutions that bring positive business impact
Partner with engineering and product teams to deploy Data Science services and embed them in the Auto1 tech infrastructure
Monitor model performance in production, share results with stakeholders and develop actionable next steps
Identify business opportunities and collaborate with stakeholders and partners in tech to drive growth
Set priorities and support junior members to achieve project goals


Qualifications


Hands-on experience with a broad range of machine learning techniques and the ability to select and adapt the most appropriate approach for complex, real-world scenarios
Experience with advanced modelling techniques, knowledge of pytorch, keras and tensorflow is a plus.
Proficiency in SQL and Python with coding best practices and code reviews in git/github
Experience in deployment in AWS/Azure/Google Cloud and CI/CD pipeline tools
Proficiency in the full lifecycle of data science projects, including initializing/designing, developing (building the model), and deploying models in production (full stack)
Strong communication skills to effectively present findings in a clear and unambiguous way


Additional Information


Possibility to work remotely, either partially or on a full-time basis
International team with flat hierarchies and open communication
Educational budget to support your continuous learning and development
Regular knowledge sharing session within team on various topics
Exciting team events every quarter
Discounts at Autohero, our platform for high-quality used cars


Contact

Marija Dimitrova

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
CrazyLabs is a top 5 mobile games publisher with over 7 billion downloads to date, and a global leader in hyper-casual game development, distribution, and innovation.

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and play a key role in shaping the success of our games. In this hands-on role, you‚Äôll work closely with product, creative, marketing, and analytics teams to build models, design experiments, and turn data into insights that drive business impact and reach millions of players worldwide.

Responsibilities


Define data science goals that drive business impact and align with key company KPIs
Develop and optimize LTV models to support product and monetization decisions
Lead the design and implementation of robust A/B testing frameworks
Deliver actionable insights through advanced statistical modeling and data analysis
Collaborate with Product, Marketing, and Content teams to identify opportunities for growth and improvement
Translate complex data into clear recommendations that influence product roadmaps and strategy


Requirements:

Requirements


5+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar role in mobile gaming industry,
Strong background in statistics and mathematics
Hands-on experience building and maintaining LTV models
Deep expertise in A/B testing methodologies and experiment design
Proven experience in the gaming industry ‚Äì a must
Advanced SQL and Python skills ‚Äì required
Familiarity with large-scale data environments and cloud-based technologies ‚Äì an advantage
Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence and lead cross-functional initiatives


What We Offer


The chance to work on products that reach millions of players
A creative,collaborative and continuous learning environment
Transparent culture with honest feedback and open communication
Full ownership and real impact on business outcomes
Fully remote work with flexible starting hours
Continuous learning and personal growth encouraged

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and play a key role in shaping the success of our games. In this hands-on role, you‚Äôll work closely with product, creative, marketing, and analytics teams to build models, design experiments, and turn data into insights that drive business impact and reach millions of players worldwide.

Responsibilities

  • Define data science goals that drive business impact and align with key company KPIs
  • Develop and optimize LTV models to support product and monetization decisions
  • Lead the design and implementation of robust A/B testing frameworks
  • Deliver actionable insights through advanced statistical modeling and data analysis
  • Collaborate with Product, Marketing, and Content teams to identify opportunities for growth and improvement
  • Translate complex data into clear recommendations that influence product roadmaps and strategy

Requirements:

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar role in mobile gaming industry,
  • Strong background in statistics and mathematics
  • Hands-on experience building and maintaining LTV models
  • Deep expertise in A/B testing methodologies and experiment design
  • Proven experience in the gaming industry ‚Äì a must
  • Advanced SQL and Python skills ‚Äì required
  • Familiarity with large-scale data environments and cloud-based technologies ‚Äì an advantage
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence and lead cross-functional initiatives

What We Offer

  • The chance to work on products that reach millions of players
  • A creative,collaborative and continuous learning environment
  • Transparent culture with honest feedback and open communication
  • Full ownership and real impact on business outcomes
  • Fully remote work with flexible starting hours
  • Continuous learning and personal growth encouraged

Title: Senior Data Scientist (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

We are seeking a technically skilled and passionate Senior Data Scientist with expertise in advanced machine learning methods to join our international and dynamic Data Science department at AUTO1 Group Technology. AUTO1 Group is Europe's leading digital automotive platform. We revolutionise the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de, and AUTO1.com

We are dedicated to leverage cutting-edge technology to develop Machine Learning Solutions that optimize our sales and processes. As a senior data scientist, you will shape the next generation of data-driven pricing solutions that power all stages of our business, from retail to dealer networks. This includes designing and evolving advanced modeling approaches, exploring scalable architectures, and building a versatile library of machine learning algorithms that address complex challenges and deliver measurable impact. Your work will focus on creating flexible, high-impact solutions that improve pricing strategies while driving end-to-end development ‚Äî from researching and prototyping novel ideas to deploying scalable models in production.

We are excited to work with talented contributors. Join us in shaping the future of automotive dealer sales with machine learning solutions!

Job Description


Contribute to building a robust model library and pricing platform that drives measurable business impact and ensures long-term scalability
Translate business needs into machine learning solutions that bring positive business impact
Partner with engineering and product teams to deploy Data Science services and embed them in the Auto1 tech infrastructure
Monitor model performance in production, share results with stakeholders and develop actionable next steps
Identify business opportunities and collaborate with stakeholders and partners in tech to drive growth
Set priorities and support junior members to achieve project goals


Qualifications


Hands-on experience with a broad range of machine learning techniques and the ability to select and adapt the most appropriate approach for complex, real-world scenarios
Experience with pricing models and pytorch would be considered an advantage
Proficiency in SQL and Python with coding best practices and code reviews in git/github
Experience in deployment in AWS/Azure/Google Cloud and CI/CD pipeline tools
Proficiency in the full lifecycle of data science projects, including initializing/designing, developing (building the model), and deploying models in production (full stack)
Strong communication skills to effectively present findings in a clear and unambiguous way


Additional Information


Possibility to work remotely, either partially or on a full-time basis
International team with flat hierarchies and open communication
Educational budget to support your continuous learning and development
Regular knowledge sharing session within team on various topics
Exciting team events every quarter
Discounts at Autohero, our platform for high-quality used cars


Contact

Marija Dimitrova

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Staff Data Scientist - (Quick Commerce)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Data Scientist to join our Quick Commerce Commercial Tribe. In this role you will be exposed to various topics related to our Quick Commerce business ‚Äì assortment optimisation, content generation, promotion effectiveness improvement, and ranking. You will help other Data Scientists to deliver high quality solutions, challenge our assumptions and improve DS practices across our teams.

As a Staff Data Scientist, you will work closely with multiple cross-functional teams (Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, and Software Engineers) to build and maintain highly scalable and reliable ML services deployed in dozens of countries globally with millions of customers.

If you're a skilled Data Scientist and creative problem solver who is eager to deliver solutions and hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!


Guide the discovery of new innovative data products from conception to operationalization to help optimize our systems and improve the experience for our users.
Keep yourself up to date and suggest state-of-the-art models to find out what works best for our customers.
Be the main reference point for new research and tech quality of Data Science in Qcommerce Commercial & Media Solutions tribes.
Enable collaboration and knowledge sharing by pushing cross teams‚Äô projects.
Set up our teams for success by creating a long-term vision, a mid-term strategy, and several short-term roadmaps toward some of the most complex and interesting data problems.
Last but not least, you are not afraid to build global systems that are used by thousands of people and constantly strive for excellence.


Qualifications


Strong Statistical & ML Foundation ‚Äì Comfortable with fundamentals, first-principles thinking, and ML theory across various domains.
Software Engineering Best Practices ‚Äì Write maintainable Python code, ensuring high standards in production systems (observability, monitoring, performance).
Domain Expertise ‚Äì Deep knowledge in at least one relevant area, such as causal inference, time series, Bayesian methods, NLP/LLM, ranking/matching, or advanced experimentation.
Data-Driven Approach ‚Äì Carefully question assumptions before working on use cases and prioritize clean, reliable data.
Effective Communication & Agile Mindset ‚Äì Filter and prioritize stakeholder requirements, focusing on MVPs and agile development.
Mentorship & Collaboration ‚Äì Support team growth through mentoring while emphasizing reliability, disciplined experimentation, and data-focused development.


Nice to Have:


Leadership & Operational Excellence ‚Äì Proven leadership in driving operational excellence and best practices within engineering teams.
System Design & Scalability ‚Äì Experience designing and implementing large, scalable distributed systems using microservices and heterogeneous platform components, with knowledge of GCP.
Expertise in Testing & Knowledge Sharing ‚Äì Strong background in A/B testing to analyze model effectiveness, with a record of knowledge sharing through conferences or publications.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts and Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Scientist- Data Product (m/f/d)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist to help us accomplish our mission to improve and extend lives by learning from the experience of every person with cancer. Are you ready to be the next changemaker in cancer care?

Flatiron Health is a healthtech company using data for good to power smarter care for every person with cancer, around the world. Flatiron partners with cancer centers in the US, Europe and Asia to transform patients‚Äô real-life experiences into real-world evidence and create a more modern, connected oncology ecosystem. Our multidisciplinary teams include oncologists, data scientists, data analysts, software engineers, research scientists, product experts and more. Flatiron Health is an independent affiliate of the Roche Group.

What You'll Do

This role is part of our International Data Science team. The Data Science Team is a diverse and talented group of individuals with strong data expertise and understanding of our customers‚Äô needs.

Building on 10 years of experience in the US, Flatiron‚Äôs international team is scaling Flatiron‚Äôs approach in new countries. Streamlined teams in each market are establishing partnerships with local cancer care providers and developing high-quality real-world data for researchers around the world. Data Scientists are embedded in those teams and play a key role in understanding our data partners‚Äô source data, conducting exploratory data analyses, developing data models, building research-grade data sets, and supporting data-driven decision-making.

As part of this work, you will:



Become a subject matter expert on our data and its capabilities.
Work closely with a cross-functional team (e.g., product managers, software engineers, oncologists, clinical data specialists) to develop new real-world data products.
Establish strong relationships with key stakeholders at our partner sites and collaborate with them to develop a deep understanding their data.
Become a subject matter expert in the format, quality, content and sources of data from our partners.
Conduct exploratory analyses to inform our approaches to source data ingestion from partners.
Conduct data cleaning and define business logic to transform data into Flatiron‚Äôs common data model.
Collaborate with software engineers to implement data pipelines.
Provide analytic support and create custom data outputs for cross-functional teams such as our team of clinical experts.



Who You Are

You're a kind, collaborative and analytic problem solver and value the opportunity to think beyond the way things are. In addition,



You have a BS or MS from a technical field of study (e.g. data science, engineering, computer science, mathematics, applied statistics, health economics, etc.) with 3-6 years of relevant experience.
You‚Äôre impact-oriented, and care deeply about creating real change for customers, users, and ultimately patients. You choose the right, rather than the flashiest, method available to reach your goals.
You are proficient in SQL and Python.
You have strong data empathy and enjoy the process of exploring and developing a deep understanding of new data sources.
You have an understanding of key statistical concepts and the ability to generate and interpret statistical analyses.
You are a clear and confident communicator who can break down complex data analyses to tell a compelling story.
You are a self-starter with a strong sense of ownership who can independently prioritize and who enjoys coming up with innovative solutions to challenging problems.
You are passionate about our mission to improve cancer care through data and technology.
You enjoy working in a fast-paced startup-like environment.
You are proficient in English and German.



Extra Credit



You have prior experience in healthcare.
You have experience working in DBT, Snowflake or are excited to learn.



Who We Are

Our people are at the center of everything we do. We strive to foster a culture where our teammates feel equipped and empowered to make meaningful contributions with confidence, compassion, and clarity. Visit the Life at Flatiron page to learn more.

Title: Data Scientist - Power Trading (m/f/d)
Description:
üåê We are on the mission to build Europe‚Äôs leading energy management platform to provide fair, clean energy to everyone. ‚ö°

We‚Äôre a diverse team of 47+ employees, with 47% being female and from 16+ nationalities, and steadily growing. Having raised of over ‚Ç¨40 M in total, we are looking for passionate people to join us on our mission! üöÄ

üá©üá™ Wir haben eine klare Mission: Wir bauen Europas f√ºhrende Plattform f√ºr Energiemanagement, um faire und saubere Energie f√ºr alle zug√§nglich zu machen. ‚ö°

Unser Team ist vielf√§ltig ‚Äì wir sind √ºber 47 Personen aus mehr als 16 Nationalit√§ten, mit einem Frauenanteil von 47 %. Und wir wachsen weiter!

Mit √ºber 40 Mio. ‚Ç¨ an Finanzierung suchen wir nach motivierten Menschen, die gemeinsam mit uns die Energiezukunft gestalten wollen. üöÄ

Your mission

We are looking for a motivated Data Scientist ‚Äì Power Trading (m/f/d) to support us in the green revolution of the electricity market as a digital electricity provider.

As part of our Finance team, you will contribute to the ongoing development and continuous optimization of our power sourcing, hedging, and trading processes.

Your Key Responsibilities Will Include


Building and maintaining forecasting models for energy consumption, energy prices, and related variables
Managing the entire model lifecycle ‚Äì from development and deployment on AWS to monitoring and regular retraining
Supporting data-driven decision-making in trading and procurement through robust and scalable models


You will work closely with colleagues across the business to ensure that our energy sourcing strategies remain data-driven, adaptive, and aligned with market dynamics.

Your tasks


Develop scalable forecasting models for household electricity consumption, PV generation, and EV charging flexibility, capable of handling a large number of households
Develop forecasting models (e.g., electricity prices) to support risk management and algorithmic trading
Support the procurement and integration of feature data for models, such as weather forecasts
Take full ownership of the entire model lifecycle, including deployment on AWS, performance monitoring, and retraining
Contribute to the development of our hedging and algorithmic trading platform


Your profile


Master‚Äôs degree in a highly quantitative discipline and 2+ years of industry experience in forecasting
Strong foundation in applied mathematics, including statistics, stochastic processes, linear algebra, (numerical) analysis, and optimization
Proficiency in machine learning, forecasting, and time series analysis
Solid understanding of MLOps and data engineering, including experience deploying ML models to production
Strong software engineering skills and the ability to write production-level Python code with automated testing
Basic understanding of trading and risk management‚Äîor a willingness to acquire this knowledge to evaluate the business impact of your models
Hands-on mentality and a self-driven, solution-oriented approach to complex problems
Excellent communication skills in English (B2‚ÄìC1), both written and spoken
Strong team player who thrives in a young, dynamic environment


Nice to have


A PhD or similar experience demonstrating your ability to independently solve complex problems that have no off-the-shelf solutions
Experience working with asynchronously generated sensor data
German communication skills
Familiarity with the German energy market
Previous experience working in start-up environments


üåê About Us

We‚Äôre Germany‚Äôs fastest-growing digital green energy provider and a Certified B Corp‚Ñ¢ , driving the energy transition by making renewable energy more accessible and inclusive.

How? Through variable tariffs, dynamic pricing, smart EV charging, heat pump and solar optimization, and Germany‚Äôs first virtual power plant: NeoGrid‚Ñ¢.

At Ostrom, you‚Äôll work in a dynamic, open environment where you can be yourself, take on challenges, and grow both personally and professionally.

üå±Environmental Impact: Each customer who switches to Ostrom on average helps offset 1.5 tons of CO2 emissions per year compared to the average German energy mix.

üìà VSOP: On top of offering a competitive salary you will have access to company shares to ensure you can truly be part of the journey.

‚úàÔ∏è Relocation package: We won't let distance get in the way, we offer visa and relocation support.

üë≠ Trust-based Team: A truly flat hierarchy and transparent company culture, where everyone‚Äôs voice matters.

üí™üèΩBenefits: An annual learning budget, company-pension scheme, company events, discounted gym membership, public transport ticket, e-bike or e-moped, Futurebens or monthly vouchers - the choice is yours.

üí¨ Stay In The Loop: We believe in transparent communication ‚Äî from weekly town halls and quarterly updates to regular retrospectives. Got feedback or an idea? We‚Äôre all ears.

ü§ù Work Together, Celebrate Together: We thrive on collaboration. Wins are shared and so are the celebrations from monthly happy hours to team trips and company events.

üåç Work Your Way: Whether you prefer the office, your home desk, or a sunny spot in Sardinia ‚Äî you work where you work best.

üöÄ Learn By Doing: We grow together with personal development paths, learning budgets, and regular knowledge-sharing sessions. Try things out, learn along the way, and keep moving forward.

üá©üá™ √úber Uns

Wir sind der am schnellsten wachsende digitale √ñkostromanbieter mit B Corp‚Ñ¢ Zertifizierung in Deutschland ‚Äì und treiben die Energiewende aktiv voran. Unser Ziel: Erneuerbare Energie f√ºr alle zug√§nglich und inklusiv machen.

Wie? Mit variablen Tarifen, dynamischem Strompreis, Smart EV Charging, Optimierung von W√§rmepumpen und Solaranlagen sowie Deutschlands erstem virtuellen Kraftwerk: NeoGrid‚Ñ¢.

Bei Ostrom arbeitest du in einem offenen, dynamischen Umfeld, in dem du du selbst sein kannst, Herausforderungen annimmst und dich kontinuierlich weiterentwickelst.

üå± Nachhaltigkeit, die z√§hlt: Mit deinem Wechsel zu Ostrom unterst√ºtzt du aktiv die Energiewende. Unsere Kund*innen helfen im Schnitt, j√§hrlich 1,5 Tonnen CO‚ÇÇ gegen√ºber dem deutschen Durchschnittsstrommix einzusparen.

üìà Wertsch√§tzung, die sich auszahlt: Neben einem attraktiven Gehalt erh√§ltst du bei uns VSOPs ‚Äì Unternehmensanteile, mit denen du direkt am Erfolg von Ostrom beteiligt bist.

üåê We are on the mission to build Europe‚Äôs leading energy management platform to provide fair, clean energy to everyone. ‚ö°

We‚Äôre a diverse team of 47+ employees, with 47% being female and from 16+ nationalities, and steadily growing. Having raised of over ‚Ç¨40 M in total, we are looking for passionate people to join us on our mission! üöÄ

üá©üá™ Wir haben eine klare Mission: Wir bauen Europas f√ºhrende Plattform f√ºr Energiemanagement, um faire und saubere Energie f√ºr alle zug√§nglich zu machen. ‚ö°

Unser Team ist vielf√§ltig ‚Äì wir sind √ºber 47 Personen aus mehr als 16 Nationalit√§ten, mit einem Frauenanteil von 47 %. Und wir wachsen weiter!

Mit √ºber 40 Mio. ‚Ç¨ an Finanzierung suchen wir nach motivierten Menschen, die gemeinsam mit uns die Energiezukunft gestalten wollen. üöÄ

Your mission

We are looking for a motivated Data Scientist ‚Äì Power Trading (m/f/d) to support us in the green revolution of the electricity market as a digital electricity provider.

As part of our Finance team, you will contribute to the ongoing development and continuous optimization of our power sourcing, hedging, and trading processes.

Your Key Responsibilities Will Include

  • Building and maintaining forecasting models for energy consumption, energy prices, and related variables
  • Managing the entire model lifecycle ‚Äì from development and deployment on AWS to monitoring and regular retraining
  • Supporting data-driven decision-making in trading and procurement through robust and scalable models

You will work closely with colleagues across the business to ensure that our energy sourcing strategies remain data-driven, adaptive, and aligned with market dynamics.

Your tasks

  • Develop scalable forecasting models for household electricity consumption, PV generation, and EV charging flexibility, capable of handling a large number of households
  • Develop forecasting models (e.g., electricity prices) to support risk management and algorithmic trading
  • Support the procurement and integration of feature data for models, such as weather forecasts
  • Take full ownership of the entire model lifecycle, including deployment on AWS, performance monitoring, and retraining
  • Contribute to the development of our hedging and algorithmic trading platform

Your profile

  • Master‚Äôs degree in a highly quantitative discipline and 2+ years of industry experience in forecasting
  • Strong foundation in applied mathematics, including statistics, stochastic processes, linear algebra, (numerical) analysis, and optimization
  • Proficiency in machine learning, forecasting, and time series analysis
  • Solid understanding of MLOps and data engineering, including experience deploying ML models to production
  • Strong software engineering skills and the ability to write production-level Python code with automated testing
  • Basic understanding of trading and risk management‚Äîor a willingness to acquire this knowledge to evaluate the business impact of your models
  • Hands-on mentality and a self-driven, solution-oriented approach to complex problems
  • Excellent communication skills in English (B2‚ÄìC1), both written and spoken
  • Strong team player who thrives in a young, dynamic environment

Nice to have

  • A PhD or similar experience demonstrating your ability to independently solve complex problems that have no off-the-shelf solutions
  • Experience working with asynchronously generated sensor data
  • German communication skills
  • Familiarity with the German energy market
  • Previous experience working in start-up environments

üåê About Us

We‚Äôre Germany‚Äôs fastest-growing digital green energy provider and a Certified B Corp‚Ñ¢ , driving the energy transition by making renewable energy more accessible and inclusive.

How? Through variable tariffs, dynamic pricing, smart EV charging, heat pump and solar optimization, and Germany‚Äôs first virtual power plant: NeoGrid‚Ñ¢.

üöÄ Learn By Doing: We grow together with personal development paths, learning budgets, and regular knowledge-sharing sessions. Try things out, learn along the way, and keep moving forward.

üá©üá™ √úber Uns

Wir sind der am schnellsten wachsende digitale √ñkostromanbieter mit B Corp‚Ñ¢ Zertifizierung in Deutschland ‚Äì und treiben die Energiewende aktiv voran. Unser Ziel: Erneuerbare Energie f√ºr alle zug√§nglich und inklusiv machen.

Wie? Mit variablen Tarifen, dynamischem Strompreis, Smart EV Charging, Optimierung von W√§rmepumpen und Solaranlagen sowie Deutschlands erstem virtuellen Kraftwerk: NeoGrid‚Ñ¢.

Bei Ostrom arbeitest du in einem offenen, dynamischen Umfeld, in dem du du selbst sein kannst, Herausforderungen annimmst und dich kontinuierlich weiterentwickelst.

Title: Looking for a computer vision and ML engineer
Description:
We are a pre-seed femtech startup building pHera: an ultra-precise colorimetric vaginal pH test that can be read using a cellphone camera and machine learning for accuracy. The system would detect colorimetric images and predict with a high level of accuracy discrete pH values, delivering lab-quality diagnostic precision to women and doctors - anytime, anywhere!


Tasks


To make pHera robust and scalable, pHera is looking for a computer vision and machine learning engineer to design and implement the complete computer-vision pipeline: from image capture, colour detection and pH prediction.





Implement computer vision algorithms for color detection from captured images


Integrate machine learning models for accurate pH prediction based colour detection


Ensure performance across different smartphone devices and lighting conditions





Applicants who clearly outline in thier cover letter how they would implement these three tasks will be prioritised.


Requirements



Based in Berlin


Eager to work in an early-stage, science-driven, female health startup


Comfortable with ambiguity, self-directed, and proactive



Benefits


Flexibility: choose freelance, part-time or full-time




Hybrid work environment with office space in Berlin




A competitive salary for 6 months with the possibility of extension




pHera is closing the gender health gap!

Most existing vaginal pH test strips are analog, low-resolution, visually subjective, and

poorly suited for women‚Äôs health applications. Doctors need fast, reliable tools to

help with complicated diagnoses. Women deserve clarity, not guesswork when

managing their vaginal health from home. A high-resolution pH test can catch

imbalances early, making it easier to monitor issues like bacterial vaginosis,

recurring vaginal infections, sexually transmitted infections, ovulation, PCOS, and

menopause. By building pHera, you would be building a tool that would advance women's health.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Hamburg, Berlin, hybrid

DEPT¬Æ/AI has a single mission: to make the best work in the industry using AI to enhance everything we do. This role sits within our EMEA Data & AI practice, which has deep expertise in leveraging AI. The team includes data strategists, consultants, data scientists and analysts that work alongside DEPT¬Æ teams around the world across different services ‚Äì from commerce, to full-funnel media, content engineering to internal operations. You will be solving some of the hardest and most challenging problems facing some of the best loved brands in the world ‚Äì and doing this alongside an experienced team.

Job Purpose

We are seeking a talented and passionate Data Scientist to join our growing team. As a Data Scientist, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and deploying innovative solutions for our clients across various industries. You will collaborate with a team of experts to solve complex business challenges using cutting-edge technologies.

Key Responsibilities


Design data-driven solutions tailored to client challenges, leveraging advanced analytical methods, ML models, and AI technologies to deliver business value.
Build predictive models to assess media effectiveness, forecast customer behavior, and recommend personalized content or products, informed by a deep understanding of customer journeys and marketing objectives.
Implement end-to-end scalable ML systems - including model training, inferencing, deployment, and monitoring - leveraging latest cloud technologies.
Perform advanced statistical analysis including A/B testing, causal inference, and experimental design
Work closely with data engineers, analysts, consultants and clients - taking a leading role in guiding and integrating efforts to ensure seamless development of solutions that create business impact
Communicate complex technical solutions to clients in an understandable way, delivering progress reports and demonstrations
Consult and guide clients on data and ML implementation, serving as a trusted advisor on data-driven decision making



What We Are Looking For


MSc degree in a highly analytical and quantitative discipline like Econometrics, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or Artificial Intelligence
Experience in advanced analytics, data science and/or ML engineering roles
A strong foundation in traditional statistical methods (e.g. regression, time series, probabilistic models), combined with a proactive mindset for exploring and applying cutting-edge developments in ML and AI.
Understanding of customer experience principles and marketing analytics including customer journey mapping, conversion optimization, and media effectiveness.
Proficiency in Python with extensive experience in data science libraries (e.g.scikit-learn, pandas, NumPy, SciPy, etc)
Experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, XGBoost, LightGBM, or similar
Strong SQL skills and experience with data warehousing solutions (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift)
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and their ML and AI services (SageMaker, Azure ML, Vertex AI)
Knowledge of MLOps tools including Docker, MLflow, Kubeflow, or similar platforms
Experience with version control (Git) and collaborative development practices
Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Strong communication skills with ability to explain technical concepts to business audiences



WE OFFER


Flexible, hybrid working policy (1-2 days at the office, depending on location);
Company pension scheme.
Lease bike options / JobRad and 25% subsidy for the Deutschlandticket.
Occasional breakfast/lunch at the office, Smoothie Tuesdays.
Stay happy and healthy with a contribution to your health through the OpenUp platform;
‚Ç¨30 per month - You can use the flexible package for digital food stamps and/or fitness providers/sport clubs/massage studios, internet costs, and/ or public transport.
Future Bens - Exclusive access to sustainable, healthy products at attractive deals.
Social events, plenty of opportunities to connect with colleagues through organised activities and celebrations.
A reputation for doing good. DEPT¬Æ has been a Certified B Corp¬Æ since 2021 and named ‚ÄòAgency of the Year‚Äô at both The Lovies and The Webby Awards.
Awesome clients. Whether big or small, local or global ‚Äî at DEPT¬Æ you‚Äôll get the opportunity to work with clients of all sizes and across all industries. And we celebrate all of our successes together!
The opportunity for possibility. We want to enable you to do what you do best and help you develop your skills further with training, development and certifications.
Global annual DEPT¬Æ Cares Month in which employees come together and donate their skills to support local charities.



WHO ARE WE?

We are pioneers at heart. What does that mean? We are always looking forward, thinking of what we can create tomorrow that does not exist today. We were born digital and we are a new model of agency, with a deep skillset in tech and marketing. That‚Äôs why we hire curious, self-driven, talented people who never stop innovating.

Our culture is big enough to cope and small enough to care. Meaning, that with people across 30+ countries, we‚Äôre big enough to provide you with the best tools, global opportunities, and benefits that help you thrive. While acting small by investing in you, your growth, your team, and giving you the autonomy to solve our clients problems, no matter where you are in the world.

DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION

At DEPT¬Æ, we take pride in creating an inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal opportunity to thrive. We actively seek to recruit, develop, nurture, and retain talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with varying skills and perspectives.

Not sure you meet all qualifications? Apply, and let us decide! Research shows that women and members of underrepresented groups tend not to apply for jobs when they think they may not meet every requirement, when in fact they do. We believe in giving everyone a fair chance to shine.

We also encourage you to reach out to us and discuss any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you throughout the recruitment process and your time with us.

Want to know more about our dedication to diversity, equity, and inclusion? Check out our efforts here.

Wir suchen Dich ‚Äì f√ºr den n√§chsten Schritt in der Welt der KI-gest√ºtzten Bildverarbeitung!

Du brennst f√ºr Machine Learning und Deep Learning? Dein Herz schl√§gt f√ºr innovative Anwendungen in Computer Vision und Bildanalyse? Dann komm in ein Team, das sich der Weiterentwicklung intelligenter Bildbearbeitungsl√∂sungen verschrieben hat!

Deine Aufgaben

  • √úbernimm eine zentrale Rolle in unserem Innovationsteam und entwickle KI-gest√ºtzte Teilprozesse f√ºr Bilderkennung, Retusche und Bildoperationen weiter.
  • Konzipiere und implementiere Machine-Learning- und Deep-Learning-Modelle ‚Äì insbesondere CNNs ‚Äì mit Fokus auf Stabilit√§t, Performance und Kundennutzen.
  • Nutze umfangreiche Datens√§tze aus bearbeiteten und unbearbeiteten Bildpaaren als Grundlage f√ºr Training und Optimierung deiner Modelle.
  • Bringe deine Ideen ein, teste neue Ans√§tze und entwickle L√∂sungen, die die Qualit√§t und Effizienz unserer Services auf ein neues Level heben.

Voraussetzungen

  • Fundierte Erfahrung in Machine Learning und Deep Learning ‚Äì idealerweise mit Schwerpunkt auf Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs).
  • Kenntnisse in Computer Vision und Bildanalyse-Techniken (z. B. Filterung, Segmentierung, Merkmalsextraktion) sind ein starkes Plus.
  • Souver√§ner Umgang mit Frameworks und Libraries wie TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras oder OpenCV.
  • Spa√ü an praxisnaher Entwicklung und dem kreativen Einsatz gro√üer Bilddatenbest√§nde.
  • Du sprichst flie√üend Deutsch oder Englisch.

Vorteile

  • Ein abwechslungsreiches Umfeld mit echten Gestaltungsm√∂glichkeiten und viel Raum f√ºr neue Ideen.
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten, die M√∂glichkeit auf Homeoffice und ein Standort mitten in Berlin mit exzellenter Verkehrsanbindung ‚Äì Jobticket-Zuschuss inklusive.
  • Moderne Tools, hochwertige Ausstattung und ein gro√üartiges, kollegiales Team.
  • Kostenlose Snacks, Obst, Kaffee und regelm√§√üige Teamevents geh√∂ren f√ºr uns genauso dazu wie gezielte Unterst√ºtzung bei Seminaren und Fortbildungen.
  • Wir legen Wert auf eine offene, vertrauensvolle Arbeitsatmosph√§re ‚Äì niemand schaut dir √ºber die Schulter, das Ergebnis z√§hlt!

Klingt spannend?

Wir freuen uns darauf, dich kennenzulernen! Bewirb dich einfach direkt √ºber unser Online-Formular oder sende uns deine Unterlagen inklusive Starttermin und Gehaltsvorstellung.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to help us accomplish our mission to improve and extend lives by learning from the experience of every person with cancer. Are you ready to be the next changemaker in cancer care?

Flatiron Health is a healthtech company using data for good to power smarter care for every person with cancer, around the world. Flatiron partners with cancer centers in the US, Europe and Asia to transform patients‚Äô real-life experiences into real-world evidence and create a more modern, connected oncology ecosystem. Our multidisciplinary teams include oncologists, data scientists, software engineers, epidemiologists, product experts and more. Flatiron Health is an independent affiliate of the Roche Group.

What You'll Do

At Flatiron, we‚Äôre advancing the use of machine learning, generative AI, and natural language processing to extract clinically relevant information from unstructured medical notes for use in oncology research. The Data Curation team is helping to build these next generation research data products, developing and applying ML models to capture a complete picture of the patient journey

As part of our team, you will develop and validate models to solve applied clinical problems and help build towards our vision of the future of machine learning at Flatiron. Engaging with a cross-functional group of stakeholders across our teams in Europe, Japan, and the US you will contribute to model development projects from scoping through to productionization and delivery.

In addition, you'll also:



Interface with internal scientific stakeholders and customers to understand what data they need to conduct high quality research.
Build models to turn raw clinical data into high quality research variables, drawing on your knowledge of LLMs, traditional ML, and NLP techniques to determine the right methods to use for a given problem.
Work with quantitative scientists and oncologists to validate that your models can be used to generate sound scientific insights.
Collaborate with other Data Scientists to accelerate our ML capabilities and develop novel approaches to clinical data extraction from unstructured health records.
Work cross-functionally with software engineers to productionize, scale, and monitor your models.



Who You Are

You're a product-focused data scientist, with experience in leveraging ML and NLP to solve real-world problems. You're excited by the prospect of rolling up your sleeves to tackle meaningful problems each and every day. You‚Äôre a kind, passionate and collaborative problem-solver who seeks and gives candid feedback, and values the chance to make an important impact.



You have 3+ years of relevant working experience in a technical capacity, with a focus on ML. Prior experience with NLP and LLMs is strongly preferred.
You have a strong background in applying ML to solve real-world problems and a solid grasp of the underlying statistical fundamentals of ML.
You are excited to work in a startup environment, think creatively and be scrappy to get the job done. You have a nose for value and empathy for your customers
You have collaborated with other technical team members in a production development environment using formal version control, Python, and SQL.
You are proficient in English and German.



Extra Credit (Optional to add extra credit)



You have ML experience in a healthcare setting.
You have experience with the risks of bias in machine learning, health equity research/analysis or have worked with underrepresented groups in a clinical research setting.



If this sounds like you, you'll fit right in at Flatiron.
Show more
